metadata.title: CVE-2017-18509 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in net/ipv6/ip6mr.c in the Linux kernel before4.11. By setting a specific socket option, an attacker can control apointer in kernel land and cause an inet_csk_listen_stop general protectionfault, or potentially execute arbitrary code under certain circumstances.The issue can be triggered as root (e.g., inside a default LXC container orwith the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability) or after namespace unsharing. Thisoccurs because sk_type and protocol are not checked in the appropriate partof the ip6_mroute_* functions. NOTE: this affects Linux distributions thatuse 4.9.x longterm kernels before 4.9.187.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
